fr:mainmatter.html:p: A morphism {E}\xrightarrow {{p}}{B} in a category \mathcal {C} is said to be carrable when for any {A}\xrightarrow {{f}}{B}, the pullback {E\times _{B}A}\xrightarrow {{f^*p}}{A} depicted below exists.

fr:resource.fr:resource-source: \DiagramSquare { nw/style = pullback, nw = E\times _{B}A, ne = E, se = B, sw = A, south = f, east = p, west = f^*p, north = p^*f, west/style = {->,exists}, north/style = {->,exists}, }

fr:mainmatter.html:p: A carrable map {E}\xrightarrow {{p}}{B} in a category \mathcal {C} is said to be exponentiable when it is exponentiable when viewed as an object of the slice category {\mathcal {C}}_{/B}.
